text: heno nitāi bine bhāi,    rādhā-kṛṣṇa pāite nāi,
translation: The holy lotus feet of Nitāi,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    cooling like ten million moons —<br class="SongVerse__break" />In the shade of which<br class="SongVerse__break" />    the world gains soothing relief;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Without that Nitāi, O brother,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    No one can reach Rādhā and Krishna —<br class="SongVerse__break" />Clasp His lotus feet with full conviction.

text: se sambandha nāhi jāra,    vṛthā janma gelo tāra,
nitāi nā bolilo mukhe,    majilo saṁsāra-sukhe,
translation: One who never got His connection,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    passed his life in vain —<br class="SongVerse__break" />Such an animal is so very wicked;<br class="SongVerse__break" />He whose mouth never uttered ‘Nitāi,’<br class="SongVerse__break" />    merged in mundane pleasures —<br class="SongVerse__break" />How can his aristocratic lineage save him?

text: nitāiyer karuṇā habe, vraje rādhā-kṛṣṇa pābe,
translation: Maddened with pride,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    forgetting the lotus feet of Nitāi —<br class="SongVerse__break" />I embrace untruth as truth;<br class="SongVerse__break" />But when Nitāi gives His Grace<br class="SongVerse__break" />    you’ll reach Rādhā and Krishna in Vraja —<br class="SongVerse__break" />O embrace the lotus feet of Nitāi!

text: nitāiyer charaṇa satya, tā̐hāra sevaka nitya,
narottama boḍo duḥkhī, nitāi more kara sukhī
translation: The lotus feet of Nitāi are truth,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    His servitors are eternal —<br class="SongVerse__break" />Ever aspire for the shelter of His feet;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Narottam is very sad — O Nitāi make me happy —<br class="SongVerse__break" />Please keep me at Your lovely lotus feet!
